title: Stathmonotus tekla
text: Stathmonotus tekla is a species of <a href="Chaenopsidae">chaenopsid blenny</a> found in the <a href="Caribbean%20Sea">Caribbean Sea</a> from southern <a href="Florida">Florida</a> through the <a href="West%20Indies">West Indies</a> and the coast of <a href="Central%20America">Central America</a> to Colombia. It occurs in rubble areas near reefs which are covered by mats of algae and sponges or within beds of <a href="Porites%20porites">finger coral</a>, normally in waters less than deep.
